item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A friend is a person with whom I may be sincere. Before him I may think aloud. I am arrived at last in the presence of a man so real and equal, that I may drop even those undermost garments of dissimulation, courtesy, and second thought, which men never put off, and may deal with him with the simplicity and wholeness with which one chemical atom meets another." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Laurie add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I cannot live without books." -- Thomas Jefferson
